description: Correction for simulated tau object, as recommended by the TauPOG for 2023_postBPix; tau identification efficiency and fake rate scale factors (DeepTau2018v2p5VSe, DeepTau2018v2p5VSjet, DeepTau2018v2p5VSmu), tau energy scale, and tau trigger scale factors. For more info, please visit https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/viewauth/CMS/TauIDRecommendationForRun2 (This file was created on 14/08/2025)

corrections.name: DeepTau2018v2p5VSe
corrections.description: e -> tau_h fake rate SFs for DeepTau2018v2p5

inputs.name: genmatch
inputs.description: genmatch: 0 or 6 = unmatched or jet, 1 or 3 = electron, 2 or 4 = muon, 5 = real tau

corrections.name: DeepTau2018v2p5VSmu
corrections.description: mu -> tau_h fake rate SFs for DeepTau2018v2p5

inputs.name: genmatch
inputs.description: genmatch: 0 or 6 = unmatched or jet, 1 or 3 = electron, 2 or 4 = muon, 5 = real tau

corrections.name: DeepTau2018v2p5VSjet
corrections.description: DeepTau2018v2p5VSjet SFs: By default, use the DM-dependent SFs with the 'dm' flag. For analyses sensitive to high pT taus (pT>140 GeV), use the DM-dependent SFs for pT<140 and pT-binned SF for pT>140 GeV with flag 'pt'. The nominal values of the SFs are stored in the 'default' field.

inputs.name: genmatch
inputs.description: genmatch: 0 or 6 = unmatched or jet, 1 or 3 = electron, 2 or 4 = muon, 5 = real tau

inputs.name: syst
inputs.description: Systematic variations for the DM-binned SF: 'stat$i_dm$DM_up'/'stat$i_dm$DM_up' (stat. uncertainty for dm bin from ith eigenvector $i=1,2 $DM=0,1,10,11) , 'syst_alleras_up'/'syst_alleras_down' (syst. uncertainty for low pT bins correlated by eras and DM-bins) , 'syst_$ERA_up'/'syst_$ERA_down' (syst. uncertainty for low pT bins uncorrelated by eras $ERA=2016_preVFP,2016_postVFP,2017,2018) , 'syst_TES_$ERA_dm$DM_up'/'syst_TES_$ERA_$DM_down' (syst. uncertainty for low pT bins due to the tau energy scale uncorrelated by eras and DM $ERA=2016_preVFP,2016_postVFP,2017,2018) $DM=0,1,10,11 ,

corrections.name: tau_energy_scale
corrections.description: DM-dependent tau energy scale in 2023_postBPix, to be applied to reconstructed tau_h Lorentz vector (pT, mass and energy) in simulated data

inputs.name: genmatch
inputs.description: genmatch: 0 or 6 = unmatched or jet, 1 or 3 = electron, 2 or 4 = muon, 5 = real tau
